title: Annie!
body:
Well, as I'm sure we've all seen in the LoLEsports stuff, Annie is.... becoming beyond a terror. And yes, I know, there's many that are going to defend her incredibly heavily, but... Why is she allowed to have such instantaneous stunning power? I mean, Veigar used to have the same, but they changed his because they felt their wasn't any counterplay to it, so instead of nerfing the range, they gave it a delay. Annie has two abilities that are both AoE and have less than .2s of delay. Her W is completely instance while her R has about a .2ish delay for her to throw the bear. 

I should also note the only other AoE stuns are all delayed or can be dodged in some sort of way due to some kind of indicator. Leona's R has a small delay and her Q lights her shield up. Braums R has him jump up into the air, pointing at the direction of where he's going to toss it and his passive shows when you're going to get stunned to a certain degree. Sona's R shows her strum the cords and you even see the wave of light go at you. Zyra's E is like Sona's R and her own R is delayed just to do damage and further delayed before it actually knocks up. Malphite's and Hecarim's R have them charging at a location....

All in all, every form of AoE CC has a delay, long cooldown, low damage, or any of the combination of those. Annie's stun only has one indicator and that's the swirling smoke around her, but that doesn't tell you that it's coming, it simply says she can use it. She has no delays or any true indicators while having huge base damages.

What do you guys think? Should Annie get some delays of SOME kind or some travel time with her R to make her not so incredibly Dominant as a support?

replies.body:
Annie is totally getting an "Annie throws Tibbers to a target point", with an animation like the one from that cinematic.  Just a matter of time.

The core problem with Annie is that her passive isn't very healthy, but it's hard to make her kit do anything without it.  Difficult design problem.

Passive - stacks decay after 6-8 seconds of not casting a spell (Master Yi treatment)
R - range increased by 300 and has a travel time (Annie throws Tibbers like you said)

Those changes would make her so much more healthier AND fun to play.

> [{quoted}](name=Vonler,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8QopFA9O,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-03-15T20:28:12.260+0000)
>
> Passive - stacks decay after 6-8 seconds of not casting a spell (Master Yi treatment)

Completely breaks her teamfight.

> R - range increased by 300 and has a travel time (Annie throws Tibbers like you said)

Do want.

> Completely breaks her teamfight.

The change would allow some buffing to it if it really needed it. She could get the stun every 3 spells for example.

You might break her teamfight the other way.

The basic problem here is that Annie needs to engage with that stun.  That's like the whole point of being Annie.  If you make her have to hit stuff every 6-8 seconds, she'll be Qing baron randomly, her team will make sure the crab stays alive, etc.  

It's a hack that produces weird gameplay.

True. But still better than everlasting zoning passive if you ask me.

Another option would be to just give her ult a built in stun and give her a different passive. I quite like her identity as a spellslinger so maybe something like "casting spells increase spell damage by 5% for 6 seconds (stacking up to 5 times)" or something to her cdr or spell cooldowns.
But I'm sure people would not be ready to lose her early game stuns.

> [{quoted}](name=Vonler,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8QopFA9O,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-15T21:11:53.704+0000)
>
> Another option would be to just give her ult a built in stun and give her a different passive. 

I actually like that idea alot, maybe give her passive something like a ramping speed buff with spell casts and maybe give her q or w a slow so she can still compete in lane

The problem is they need to stop nerfing champs who dont need nerfs. Or "reworks"

There are a number of champs we all need a little bit of nerfbat taps.  But they never touch those.  Instead they pick some random champ who doesnt need it, nerf that champ, and then another champ seems overpowered because of all the other nerfs.

Dont fix what isnt broken..
But who is to decide what is broken? What is life, what does it all mean, why are we here?
